Reviews.Title: “Atlantic Oceanfront Inn Ocean City,MD”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This is now a hidden gem in Ocean City. The new ownership has made it a very affordable hotel with a great ocean view, and an attentive, friendly, professional staff. Janet at the front desk is especially good, helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “This rundown, poorly maintained establishment wasn't worth the money despite the great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulW
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just finished a 3 day-2 night stay at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn. The location was decent, most staff was friendly, but the accommodations were terrible! We rented an ocean front room with a king bed in a seperate bedroom and a queen bed and sofa bed in the other. The sofa covers were soiled, sand was visible on most furniture surfaces, the bathroom sink was half way torn off the wall, the bath tub/shower was rusted in most cracks and corners, the stove had a burner that wouldn't stay down, and the door separating the living areas looked like it had been punched in. In addition, we had to walk thru the bedroom to access the other living area which defeated the idea of privacy. If we used the sofa bed we had to sacrifice access to our ocean front balcany. The main door to our room was difficult to open and close. This was a very disappointing experience and a rip off for the money! Although we made the best of our trip as could, that meant staying out of our close to $350 a nite room/suite...never again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific beach hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeahHug
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this perfect oceanfront hotel this past Labor Day weekend. We stayed in an oceanfront efficiency with 2 queen beds on the 2nd floor. The view over the ocean in the mornings and during the full moon made this special location worth every penny. The check in process was extremely quick and easy, the room was clean, very private and large with all of the amenities plus a small kitchen. We checked in on Friday, intending to check out on Sunday, but we were having so much fun that we decided to stay another day. When we made our request to add a night to our stay the front desk was extremely flexible and accommodating. We didn't even have to switch rooms! Our room was only steps to the gorgeous beach and it made the walks back and forth so convenient. The hotel pool was small, but warm. very clean and not at all crowded for a holiday weekend. We enjoyed a dip for a change of pace from the beach. Janet at the front desk was pleasant, humorous and very helpful with all of our questions and requests. We absolutely loved this well located gem of an oceanfront hotel and it will be our new go-to property when we stay in Ocean City. Thanks so much for a wonderful holiday weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the beach, but maybe not perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: Rosiness
Reviews.Content: I'm actually staying here now with my husband and three small children. We originally checked in to another hotel, but had to leave there..that's a different review. Anyway, the staff is incredible, the room is great for our needs. There was no iron or ironing board and we were told there'd be a DVD player and there wasn't, however; with one mention to the staff and the items were delivered. Still debating whether or not I'd return based on the following reasons: 1. late night drinkers above and next to us the first night that woke my 15 month old several times crying, of course. 2. The girls above us continually going in and out of the room and hearing the sliding glass door all day and into early morning hours. 3. The couple having sex on the balcony above us... Really??? I'm just glad the kids were already in bed. 4. The smell of pot and the coughing from the floor right above us. Again, glad the kids were asleep. So hotel good, but it'd be nice if families were separate from the other crowds... Not too happy about that. Kind of making me uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the Beach? Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late August and had a nice visit. The room & beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a nice location and has a nice beach area right in front. Having a refrigerator & kitchenette was convenient for drinks, milk & juice for breakfast. TVs and furniture were updated. The room had some minor drawbacks with a broken door handle & lock in the bathroom. Ceiling fan in bathroom was hanging precariously. Maid service was just so-so as we had to change toilet paper rolls, and no new soap for the bathroom during the week. The outdoor shower had a large accumulation of wet sand that had built up over days if not weeks, making it hard to wash off your feet after returning from the beach. Both the 45th Street Taphouse Restaurant & Bar & O.C. Steamer's Restaurant were located a block away and we enjoyed them both. Clambake dinner @ O.C. Steamer's was fantastic, and we loved the Taphouse for "Grapefruit Crush" drinks at the outside, bar that had a great band and beautiful sunset view of the bay. Overall we had a good stay at this hotel, and would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Location, but room servicing could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip ever to Ocean City, MD. I researched a lot of hotels and for the week that I was going this was the best value. I think I got a better deal then some people. I booked in June 2012 and stayed from July 29th- August 3rd, 2012. The hotel is located right on the beach, 45h Street. It was nice, little dirty out there but I guess it is expected. I liked how the lifeguard gave safety speeches and called people out of the water to hear them. The hotel is right on the beach bus line which made it easy for traveling up and down the main street. It took about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic to get down to the Boardwalk by bus.The hotel was average. We were on the 3 floor and had a side balcony for a view of the ocean which was fine. The rooms were clean and had a kitchenette. We used the fridge for our drinks etc for the beach. The hotel was older and the halls were painted blue and yellow. The elevator door was fast to close. You had to be quick getting in and out or the door would close on you. Anyways, We were there just to sleep and shower. We were mostly at the beach. The pool closed the early, so no night swimming. I did see the guy checking the pool daily. There was coffee and juice in the mornings, but we went to Layton's and to a little place just down the street called Satellite. So, don't; expect anything big in the lounge area. I guess my only complaint would be the room service. We came back from the beach at 5pm and our room was not even done yet. I took at shower around 5:20 and it was room service. So, after my shower I went downstairs to let them know I am ready for them and they were like house cleaning is done for the day. We had this happen 2x where our room was not done and we are already coming back from our beach day. I over heard people at the pool saying the same thing. I think basically all they did was change towels and make beds. The bed was ok but the other bed kind of sank in the center. Least the TV was updated and was a 32in and flat screen.

Reviews.Title: “PICK ANOTHER PLACE IF YOI KNOW WHAT'S GOOD FOR YOU!!”
Reviews.Author: Solo0609
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to OCMD since the early 80's and this was by far the most disappointing trip ever!! The hotel was grossly overpriced (we paid over $1400 for 4 nights, the "condo" with "separate" bedrooms was nothing more than an oversized hotel room that certainly didn't have any of the amenities that a condo would have, the cable was out most of our trip, which normally wouldn't be a problem except that it rained most of the trip, we had to actually call housekeeping to ask them to bring clean towels. They would take the dirty ones, but not replace them. They have more rooms than parking spots and that was confirmed by the security guard who works the lot at night. They actually called us on Saturday evening to move our truck, but had no where for us to move it to, so we refused! So then we were afraid to leave the property for fear that we would return and not have a place to park! In addition, this place is located on 45th street and the only thing that is really within walking distance with a 9 & 6 year old was Seacrets (for lunch), otherwise there is nothing around here. As I explained to my 9 year old, when we pay over $1400 for 4 nights, we have a certain level of expectations that tend to be slightly higher, and this place failed miserably!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place To Stay Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: bpuccio
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing and I would definetly recommend staying here and plan on returning next year. The staff at the front desk were kind, curtious and always willing to help in any way they could. The rooms were beautiful with a nice size kitchenette, seating area & wonderful balcony(side view) with a view of the ocean and bay. The rooms were cleaned daily and the staff did a wonderful job. The hotel is located on the beach which was a plus. The beach was beautiful and well maintained. Also parking was always available which was another major plus. Looking forward to booking my next trip to this wonderful hotel. 5 stars *****

Reviews.Title: “Good stay.....”
Reviews.Author: ruthann b
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the hotel is right on the beach. The room is a Good size. Great view. House keeping was good for the first 3you day We put the "tip envelope" for housekeepong in the drawer For when we leave....most people I know tip when they Leave.....anyway after she left the second envelope Our housekeeping service went out the window. We had to go To the front desk for 3 days to get our towels for our Showers. Housekeeping came well after 4 and on our last Day it was after 5. She made the beds and threw the towels On the bed. I wasnt expecting 4 star treatment, but maybe A bit more for what I paid. The other problem is parking, If you go out for the night make sure your back early Or youll be hiking! Overall it wasnt bad. Just the little Things that add up. WE will know better if there is a next time. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MsOBrien21
Reviews.Content: I thought that this place was going to be the banana inn, but it turns out for my 4 friends and myself it was THE PERFECT PLACE. We had our own bathroom, full kitchen, a nice sized balcony, and we were only on the 2nd floor with a side view of the atlantic ocean :). To add to the benefits, it was walking distance to Seacrets and they had their own beach area! There's a bus stop around the corner from the inn to catch to go to the boardwalk! The beds were also nice sized and the room was very clean! One car parking per room was the only downfall because we had 2 cars, but for a girls weekend, we will def. be coming here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shannon K
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn. The hotel is right on the beach. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was very happy & would stay here again. Our room was clean & had everything we needed. The small kitchen was perfect for our family as we had our 3 year old daughter with us. The air conditioner worked great in our room. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the hotel rooms clean & fresh. The location was perfect. The hotel is close to all of the restaurants & shopping. You do need to drive to the boardwalk though. We stayed here in July 2012. The beach was not crowded in front of the hotel & there was a lifeguard right there. There was also a beach chair & umbrella rental stand right on the beach. The hotel also has beach chairs for there guests to use. This was a bonus for us. We will

Reviews.Title: “great view of the ocean, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: sdcash
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach, with nice beds. We definitely slept well. The room was clean with nice carpet and small kitchenette. Restaurants and shopping close by, but a long walk down to the boardwalk where you can pick up the tram to take you down to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Affordable Beachfront Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past May 2012 with some friends for the annual Car Show Weekend, staying from Thursday to Sunday. First off the location is perfect, right on the beach, i'm a sucker for staying ON the beach so I was very happy with the view! We had no issues checking in our room as it was already ready. We had a top floor room so the view was awesome. The room was clean and comfortable and our AC worked great, though it was only in the low 80's all weekend. The room/furniture looked recently updated and the beds were super comfortable. Everything in the room worked fine, the only issue we found in our room was that the shower head was kind of loose, not attached completely to the wall, but it still worked. Whenever we go to OCMD we try to stay as close as possible to Seacrets, and this was only two blocks away from it which was perfect. I was completely satisfied with my stay here and we will be staying here again next May for sure, I highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view!”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo G
Reviews.Content: I had an unfortunate booking incident (fraud scam) and found myself looking for a place to stay with my family while in Ocean City. My friend contacted Janet at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn and she was more than helpful. She was able to find us a room on short notice and saved our vacation. The room was nice, had a private balcony and a full kitchen. The bathrooms were clean and we had a great view of the beach. She was extremely understanding and accommodating and worked to find an available room for us. I have already recommended this property to relatives. Thanks Janet!

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location”
Reviews.Author: rwolf5
Reviews.Content: We booked early in March for a Dune level oceanfront fully realizing we would not be able to see the ocean, but, we did not want to worry about our 16 month old possibly falling off a balcony. As expected no ocean view, but, was disappointed that the rooms are still elevated and have railings preventing direct access to the beach unless you are athletic enough to hop over an approximate 3.5 foot railing with yet another 2 or so feet to go before hitting the ground. Also, all doors except the main entrance are locked at 10PM. This is not unusual for hotels, but, what is unusual is there was no option to unock the other entrances via room key necessetating an extra block walk and treking sand through the lobby. Check-in at 4:00PM was crowded and check-in was slow given it took about 15 minutes to check-in the 4 parties ahead of us. On the plus side, I've stayed in probably 8-10 other hotels in Ocean City and the only one nicer was the Hilton which is literally 3 times more expensive. The hotel was remarkedly sand free given it is beach front; I saw housekeeping using the largest, loudest, most powerful vacumn i've ever seen to clean the hallways daily. The kitchen was just the right size for our needs. The bathroom was kept clean but there were signs of mold developing between the door frame and the shower; again not suprising in an oceanfront property but it will need to be dealt with before it spreads. As stated in the title, it is a great midtown location, about 10-12 blocks from Jolly Roger Amusement Park and only 3 blocks from Seacrets, not to mention easy and inexpensive bus service to the inlet and boardwalk areas. Overall, I give this hotel 5 stars based on Ocean City standards. In a non beach areas it would probably be around 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Carousel most years but were given a very good rate at this satellite property. There were some minor inconveniences: luggage carts were in an atrocious shape, parking spaces were slightly tight, and our air conditioner though maintaining temperature, made a loud sound from sloshing water. But aside from those minor things, our view of the ocean was a ten, the location and proximity to the beach were also a ten, the staff was exceptional, the rate we received was fantastic. If we get an offer similar to this in the future, it will be my new "go-to" place.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn with my girlfriend for a quick trip to OC in July. We stayed on a Saturday, booked the room two days in advance and paid $200 + tax. This place was a great deal. You get the amenities of booking a full apartment but at the cost of a regular hotel room. It's all one big open layout, but you get a mini kitchen with a fridge, freezer, stove, microwave, kitchen sink, counters stocked with all the necessities, and a counter for prepping food and drinks. We also had a nice balcony with great views of the Ocean. There were two very comfortable beds and a nice bathroom. I saw a few other reviews about problems with A/C but we did not experience any. It was 100+ degrees during our stay and our room was nice and cold. We even had to turn the A/C down to low it was pumping out so much cold air. The Location is on 45th Street, so a very easy walk to the OC party spots... Seacrets, Macky's, etc. and it's an easy 10 minute ride down to the Boardwalk. The hotel is practically on the beach, which makes going back and forth from the beach to the Hotel very easy. Last note, the customer service was excellent. Janet greeted us when we arrived before check in time and stored some of our drinks until our room was ready so they didn't get boiling hot sitting in our car. I hope to make a return visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: k d
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two of my close friends for our senior week, not so close to the boardwalk, but nothing a short drive or bus didnt fix. It was tucked away just enough to enjoy the peaceful beach and close enough to enjoy the "party" and activities in O.C Our room was tidy and we had a little kitchen complete with stove and oven that was perfect and saved us a ton on food (I specificaly asked for the kitchen but the extra 10$ a night was worth it). The staff was nice and always answered any questions we had, Jan at the front desk greeted us and was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we ever stayed at in oc”
Reviews.Author: the4jbs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of the beach clean room. No need to look anywhere else this is the place to stay. We will definitely be back. Thank you all for an awesome vacation

Reviews.Title: “disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: sonicNj
Reviews.Content: Staff were accommodating and friendly. No complaints about that at all. However, our room,s ac was not able to cool down our room on a 90 deg weather, really uncomfortable and muggy...airconditioning is one of the most crucial reasons for staying in a hotel and enjoying a vacation....one of the staff provided us with a fan upon request which was somhow helpful but i didnt pay for a fan over a poorly workin ac....it was colder in the hallway we wanted to crash there...roon ac needscto be updated...again tnx to the guy who gave us the fan. Also when we checked in, the room smelled like burnt "mexican" food or something....i suggest a pkug in glade shld be in every full efficiency room to help oust the smell of food from the previous occupants. Febreze maybe? The housekeepers shld spray the room to make it smell clean for the next occupants who saved hard earned vacation money for a supposed enjoyable stay in an inn called atlantic ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views, Clean Rooms and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn, and I was extremely satisfied! You can't beat the incredible views from the ocean front units. The rooms were very clean, and the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and very professional! You can't beat the location, it's far enough away from the boardwalk that it's a very family friendly safe feeling hotel, but it's close enough that everything you want or need is within a few minute drive! They even have free beach chair rentals so you don't have to pack your own! My daughter and I took advantage of the pool just about every day we were there. We'd spend mornings on the beach, go site seeing in the afternoons, and then head to the pool in the evenings. I will definitely return to Atlantic Oceanfront Inn for our family vacation in OC MD next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice views”
Reviews.Author: polkadotfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value for the money. I was unable to book a room at the Carosuel and the reservation service suggested this sister hotel. It was clean and all rooms had an excellent view of the ocean. The staff was friendly as well. The best thing about the hotel is the easy access to the beach. Other than a small pool there was not much for the kids. I think that this hotel would be great for couples or a group of adults. If you have small children I would recommend that you stay at the Carosuel or some where that has more amenities for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a reasonable rate.”
Reviews.Author: debrameg
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Safe. Staff was pleasant. Nice view of the ocean. Did find a pair of shorts under the bed.

Reviews.Title: “JANICE!!”
Reviews.Author: jamie w
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience with this hotel! I checked in Friday June 8 and out June 10. My boyfriend and I along with 2 others had arrived around 10am not knowing check in wasn't till 4pm..Janice at the front desk not only gave us the first available clean room but she made sure we had a wonderful view for the air show.room 508 was perfect..we will be coming back to stay because of the exceptional job Janice did!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: rsrsq1
Reviews.Content: The location and price were very good! The view of the beach from our Oceanfront room was great. There is easy access to the beach. There is a small kitchen in the room with everything you would need to prepare a meal. Going out for a meal can be very expensive down there. The furniture was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly. They have free internet and cable TV in case the weather isn't the best. They don't have breakfast like some of the hotel chains but they did have free coffee and juice. The elevator is slow and could be improved. The cleaning staff is very nice but they only do a very basic cleaning of the room. I would certaining consider going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful! Perfect in my book!”
Reviews.Author: All4luvnlife24
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous about this hotel. There were some really awful reviews. Thankfully those review were all wrong! The front desk people we dealt with we're friendly and helpful. Our room. Our room was beautiful. A corner oceanfront. We felt like it was just us and the beach. So quiet and serene. I love this place and we will be coming back every year from now on! Thank you Atlantic Ocean Front Inn for a great anniversary, bday, and vacation. You helped us make long lasting memories.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: SLaurenH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 17th-20th for yearly car show. Place was at capacity. I've stayed at this resort prior to its renovation, so it was nice to see it cleaned up a bit on the exterior and inside the rooms. Didn't update the bathrooms however and they were pretty generic, our shower head was falling out of the wall. To me this is your typical "shore" type hotel, and was very clean and comfortable for what we needed. No bells and whistles. AC worked good. Appliances in mini kitchen looked new. We had oceanfront room and that was the best part!! Loved waking up to the view of the ocean and sound of the waves. Easy to walk to beach. Has pool in parking lot but was not open yet too cold. Parking is real pain in the neck. Make sure you have your "permit" on the dash or you will get a warning on your car saying it would be towed. My pass blew off the dash when I shut my car door and I had a warning saying it would be towed. Front desk had my info on car and told me " I had no pass" before i even said anything which kind of annoyed me. They told me this when I went down to have my keys reprogrammed which magically both stopped working, yet they were quick to place blame on us stating we had it too close to a cell phone or credit card, even though I had them seperated the whole time. This place is in walking distance to Seacrets, so you will have loud rowdy drunks coming in at 2 am. That is one if main reasons we stay at this place, but we are not out of control. Something to consider if you are a light sleeper. Place not walking distance to boardwalk. Prices were hiked up due to car show weekend, but place probably wouldn't be too bad of a deal off season or during a normal summer week. Overall decent hotel, clean, and slightly updated. Best part was how close it was to the beach and the wonderful view. Typical "shore" hotel and we weren't disappointed as we knew not to go in with high expectations. We would probably stay again if we had to.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Gail18056
Reviews.Content: I was visiting OC Maryland for my and my husband's first time . I must say how pleased I was with the staff (Janet) @ front desk . she recommended thing's to do and places to eat . She was so pleasent and easy to talk to . Loved the room , so clean and smelled so nice =) Plan on going back every year ! A++++ service and A+++ room for the price ! thank you for such a pleasant stay . Gail

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: johnzski6520
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed here this weekend based on a friends recommendation. I must say i was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly, if i had one complaint it would be the weekend went by to quickly. I will be back and will recommend it to my friends and family. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and room!”
Reviews.Author: Xyahli
Reviews.Content: It was kind of empty there because we came during April and on the weekday. It was still kind of cold. But the guy at the front desk (Ross) was really nice to us (a group of 6!) The room was in a great spot with a great view. The experience was great! I would love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Alantic Ocean Front Inn”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCritic
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11pm was in room by 11:30. I get my luggage and you have to go through a maze to get to the elevators. i was on top floor! Then i walk down the hall saw the maid said Hi to her *no responce* . Walk into the room and get a wiff of Tacos yes Tacos it smelled like a mexican fiesta. COuldn't they febreeze? The room itself was okay. The carpet was clean but the wall ehh they were Nasty the border of my balcony was black and the walls were stained. The bed was comfy, the bathroom the shower was a little nasty but not too bad. The balcony was BEATIFUL i had ocean view it was wrap around you cou;ld see the ocean great part of the bay -1 for seeing a crummy motel next door. At night time the lamp was not plugged in i wasnt i repeat NOT touching that wall. The Tv was great nice flatscreen. TIP bring your own pots my kids wouldnt eat ebcause they siad their food tasted like metal and it did the metal was so old it cripped in the oven. THe fridge was good not dirty. Now checking out, THey better fire that nasty snappy woman. I walk to the desk and ask for towels the ngith before checkign out. She looks up and says "Your goign to have to wait" it may sound good on here but she said raspy and snappy. She finnaly peers over the desk and says liek im not supposed to be there "can i help you..? Agian odd tone. I finnaly get the towels. Now checking out i got the manegar John i think his name was! He was awesome! I had trouble with my card that it wasn't goign through he sorted it all out! +1 for him he was nice, eh also was the runenr he got everyone int heir rooms their towels etc. Thanks John :) This hotel should get 2 stars but because of balcony beds and john it got 4.

Reviews.Title: “We always have a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yvette U
Reviews.Content: Every year in June, my cousin and I go to the beach for a few days to relax, shop and lay on the beach. We usually always stay at the Atlantic. I have never in all my years going here had a bad experience!! I cant say enough about the staff, and how accomidating they are! They are always there with a warm smile, prompt with whatever our needs may be! Our rooms have always been clean, and have a wonderful view. I would encourage anyone to stay in this hotel, its very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Waaaaayyy overpriced”
Reviews.Author: pukfan
Reviews.Content: Pros: on the beach, rooms large. Cons: bathroom sink about ready to fall off. Hair dryer blows room fuse (twice). No ice machine, no ice trays in freezer. Phone did not work very well (had maintenance guy come up and fix, but continued to have problems contacting even front desk). Beach chairs had to be returned by 6 pm. Check in not before 4 pm, and no late check outs past 11 am. Furniture beat up, shower head not attached to wall, all metal fixtures had rust. Had the look and feel of a communist apartment complex. No screen on sliding glass door, zero free electrical outlets. Wifi only worked in half the room. Pool small and in parking lot. DO NOT GET JOLLY ROGER COUPONS THROUGH THIS HOTEL - only good for 4 hours in the afternoon. Cost - all this for $300 a night?? Lesson learned here.....

Reviews.Title: “A Little Pricey But Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: NittanyLion11_04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year and liked it so much that we decided to return another year. This year, we stayed in one of the 5th floor King Oceanfront Efficiencies and definitely could not complain. We paid $259/night, but that is a competitive price if you have been shopping around the other hotels. The room was definitely very clean and spacious. Had all working appliances (coffee maker-didn't try it, don't know how it was, microwave, oven, fridge). The refrigerator and freezer kept our items extremely cold. The AC in the room actually worked SO well that we had to turn it DOWN a few nights since we were so cold. The view from the 5th floor is absolutely gorgeous. Everyone here, from the hotel workers, ladies cleaning the rooms, receptionist, to other vacation goers, were EXTREMELY polite! I actually could not believe how friendly people were, it's great to know that there are a lot of wonderful people still left in the world! The shower is small and the water pressure is not that great, but really, are you looking for a "great" shower when you go on vacation? I wasn't, so I don't understand when people complain about such minor things. Those who gave this hotel negative reviews had to have a horrible experience ( I don't know how that's possible unless you are annoying vacationers) because I could not find one thing wrong with this place. The pool does it's job too. Yeah, it is little, but there is a massive ocean only steps away. Again, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, don't listen to the negative reviews!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view! Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: Bluebedbug
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 2 days and we wished we could have stayed longer. The rooms we stayed in were oceanfront on the second floor. We had a GREAT view of the ocean. Rooms were clean. Medium sized rooms, bathroom was okay too. The tv was great to get the kids settled at night. The sign on the pool says it closes at 8 we enjoyed it well past 930. Water was warm but a bit sandy. Warning to smokers: the ac units kick out a of hot air, so be careful where you sit or stand on the balconies. Overall... loved this place and we stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and oceanfront - can't complain!”
Reviews.Author: LizCarlisle_PA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for two reasons. 1) It is oceanfront. 2) It had clean, affordable suites. (Other options were either $500/night high end hotels or cheap, older looking places). We weren't disappointed. We had an oceanfront suite (2 rooms) on the 5th floor with a great view. The hotel is clearly older, but besides the bathroom which was a bit 80's our suite had been recently renovated (new carpet, furniture, appliances) and it looked like the inside of the hotel was freshly painted. The couch had a couple of stains on it - not sure why they got a light color upholstery for a hotel room! Cleaning service did a good job each day. In the suite, each room had a flat screen and an iHome docking station, and the main living area had a dvd player. Room had a free safe. Room was quiet at night. We did have to hang a towel over the window in the 2nd bedroom to darken it for our young kids - there were only miniblinds on the small window there and they let in too much light in the morning. The hotel is at 45th and the boardwalk starts around 25th or 30th...It will take you 20-30 minutes to walk down to the boardwalk (we just drove down). The upside of being away from the boardwalk is that the hotel is quiet and the beach isn't overcrowded. We loved that!!! There is also a parking lot right behind the hotel and you get a space with your room - we had no trouble parking at the hotel. We had to pay $400 for Saturday night, which felt overpriced to me but then again it was oceanfront in peak season. Paid $300/night the rest of the stay which felt fair. One thing to note - the hotel is under new ownership...apparently it changed hands a few days before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Wayyyyy Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_in_DC
Reviews.Content: Although it is a beachfront hotel (that and free parking are the best two things about it), it is nowhere near worth the $300/night we paid. The front desk clerk was rude, the tiny pool is located IN the parking lot, the towels and bedding are cheap, there is no ice machine (in a $300/night hotel????), the balconies aren't very relaxing (you can hear the folks on the balcony next to you and the barking dogs from the complex next door), our Wifi wouldn't work, etc. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price great location”
Reviews.Author: JDP527
Reviews.Content: All was ok with this hotel. Bathrooms are a little dirty, there is no ice machine, and they do not give you lots of towels. However the location, staff, and beds were great. Just remember you get what you pay for, this is def a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City was great, but the hotel was lackluster at best”
Reviews.Author: ShannonW3
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website make it look much nicer than it really is. The room is outdated and the bathroom was gross. The shower had no pressure, the towels looked dirty. The only saving grace about this hotel is its super close to Seacrests and the beach. Otherwise, there's nothing good I can really say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok beach hotel, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: fqtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the July 4th weekend. I am not sure how old this hotel is, but it definitely is not the most modern one. They have parking in the back, but you need a pass to be displayed on the dashboard. They only give you one pass/room, so if anyone is meeting up with you there, it makes the parking situation a little tricky. There are some spots in front of the hotel, which are open to anybody, but they are pretty much taken all the time. You can step out of the hotel right to the beach, which is very convenient. The rooms are showing some aging. The water pressure in the shower is terrible. It makes it hard to get the sand off. Rooms have balconies. It is one big long balcony with dividers. There is not much privacy there. You can hear everything the people in the next balcony are saying. If someone smokes in the balcony nextdoor, you are inhaling the smoke. Sound proofing is pretty bad in this hotel. You can hear people flushing the toilet in the rooms next to you and above you. You can hear the people talking in the hallway, kids running in the hallway. Rooms have AC, which works well. They have a small swimming pool in the parking lot, but we went to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “good for price but some problems”
Reviews.Author: saysomething
Reviews.Content: great oceanfront view. great beach access. low price. good front desk staff. ice machine broken. older building--they tried to update, but still feels dated and dirty feeling. pool is in parking lot, next to street, and surrounded by other buildings with people hanging out on balconies. Not relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: JKA23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in June. What a wonderful surprise! The hotel was located directly on the beach and had an amazing view from our oceanfront room. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly and for the value, we couldn't have picked a nicer hotel. We are already planning our return trip for next year and we will definitely be booking a room at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “i would not recommend this hotel to anyone not even my worst enemy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandjtravelDC
Reviews.Content: We bit the bullet and stayed here for one night and one night only after being insulted by management and receiving the worst customer service experience ever during check-in. We booked 2 suites by phone and when we got there of course because we had more than two people for a two-bedroom suite they were ready to charge us more for each room. When the manager came down she was quite short and rude when we asked her why the people who booked the reservation did not tell us about this policy. Anyhow it was posted on their website so we just said okay whatever she then proceeded to say I will not rent you the room then that she will but doesn't want us to take it out on her room. When we got to the room there were holes in the cabinets, marks on the wall, dirty carpet and couch. I mean there was nothing there to mess up it was already pretty bad. Then the bathroom was so old fashioned the water pressure in the shower was a joke. I could not rinse soap off my entire body. The sink had so much water pressure the water splashed back on you and your clothes. I mean I was so glad to get out of there the next day. Basically if you are gonna stay here make sure its just for 1 night cause a week there would have killed me, I would say spend a couple extra bucks and get better service and quality accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: kdaub1105
Reviews.Content: So me and a bunch of girlfriends stayed here for my bachelorette party. We booked a suite which includes small kitchen, 2 seperate rooms, and a fabulous view of the ocean. We showed up late on the day we checked in, and the front desk gave us no problem what so ever. Only took just a minute to check in, quick and easy. Our room was on the 2nd floor, and the view was great. Kitchen and bathroom were very clean, in fact the whole room was well taken care of. Balcony was great to be able to hang out on. Only complaint about that is, you can pretty much see and hear every conversation of the people standing on the balcony next to you. Theres only a small dividing wall in between the balconies. (in fact its barely a divider) So this could make an akward situation when you walk out onto your balcony early in the morning. Beds were comfortable. Sheets were kind of rough, but clean. A/C worked well and included a remote to be able to change the temperature digitally. Water pressure in the shower was AWFUL!! Barely trickled onto you. Took like 5 minutes just to get your hair wet! We were only on the 2nd floor, so I couldnt even imagine what the water pressure is like on the higher floors. Only like 3 blocks from SEACRETS! Perfect for a late night walking home. Checked out the next morning, staff was super nice, and was truely interested on how our night was. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone looking to have a nice time in OC MD. Great place to stay, and if and when I go back ill definitely book my trip here!

Reviews.Title: “Yearly Trip”
Reviews.Author: 100HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Once again, we checked into the Atlantic Oceanfront during the Labor Day weekend. My parents and I take our annual trip there and always stay at this hotel. I've found you can't beat it for the price. It is well within budget, especially for an Oceanfront. The view is spectacular. From the time we checked in until checkout, our every need was met. The staff is friendly and accomodating. We had no complaints. I would much rather stay here than spend $300.00 plus for the high end hotels. Although we don't spend much time in the room, there are kitchen facilities. So if you choose not to go out to dinner, you can take out and eat in the room. There is a round table and chairs that will accomodate 4 people. I also like the flat screen TV. The furniture is basic, but that is not a problem. We plan to go back during the summer of 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: twitt5032
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, great location, comfortable room and great ocean view

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied once again”
Reviews.Author: LaylaAnn65
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed it so much last time we wanted to try it again. First of all, we were to arrive late on a Thursday evening but due to the torrential rain of TS Nicole we had to delay our arrival until Friday morning. We called and explained the situation and they didn't charge us for the night. Our room met our expectations. As it is the end of the season, the wear and tear of many vacationers is noticeable but it was clean. The corridor carpets are in need of replacement. The balcony rails had been replaced since 2009. The view and location away from the boardwalk is what we enjoy the most. The housekeeping staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: prettybrowneyes83
Reviews.Content: We drove up from Jersey for a long weekend on the weekend following Labor Day. The hotel is literally steps from the beach. The staff was friendly and inviting and the room was spotless and smelled fresh. My only comment is we got a room with 2 queen beds and the one closest to the TV was lumpy and not comfortable. This is a basic 3 star, clean hotel and offers a large efficiency hotel room with a complete kitchen. They do not have an elaborate lobby, restaurants or a lounge but they do offer reasonably priced and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL RIGHT ON THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: pleighdoe
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay at this inn, we loved it the first time and plan to keep returning. the value is good but i do miss the offer they had last year, the birthday club, you get your age off in dollars off your stay thats a great help when you vacation with family. i'll have to give a suggestion to give returning guest a discount besides the 10% with auto club. love the room looking at the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “I really really had a wonderful stay. I...”
Reviews.Author: Jessica419
Reviews.Content: I really really had a wonderful stay. I loved the location and I would definitely stay here each and every time I visit ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “I Love staying at the Atlantic oceanfront INN everyone is great the service is great and the amenities are awesome !”
Reviews.Author: Cecil26
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and renovated it's such a delight to stay here wish we could book for a week!!!

Reviews.Title: “My second stay and planning a third!”
Reviews.Author: mh2by2
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn in October 2009 on a girls' weekend. I was very happy with my stay and immediately booked a week for August 2010 for my daughters-in-law and my grands. We enjoyed our recent week long stay. The location is unbeatable. The oceanfront suite was comfortable and allowed the moms some privacy from the kids and the kids a quiet place to nap. We made full use of the kitchen which is very handy when young children are along. Although the hotel is older the improvements are comfortable and the wifi was great. Our rooms were clean and extra towels were provided promptly. I will be returning for another girls' weekend October 2010 and am greatly looking forward to it. This is my first choice for Ocean City trips.

Reviews.Title: “We have been coming here for years, and the hotel is remodeled and much more professionally managed then ever before.”
Reviews.Author: lucasj5
Reviews.Content: We love the location (off the Boardwalk) and the suite is perfect for our family of five (three teenagers). The newly remodeled rooms, clean kitchen, and view are perfect! We keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid beach accomodations--nothing fancy, but what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: brunus76
Reviews.Content: Just visited here with my wife and young children. The hotel itself is standard Ocean City fare--in other words, is showing some age and could probably use a facelift and some updating. But the beach access is great, parking was not a problem, and the efficiency kitchen saved us a bundle since we didn't have to eat every meal out. All of these far outwiegh any deficiencies I saw. It ain't fancy, but for what it is, it is pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, and beautiful view.”
Reviews.Author: NittanyLion11_04
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from our trip to Ocean City. We stayed at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn on 45th street. It was absolutely great. We stayed in one of the 5th floor rooms which was oceanview had a king bed, & full efficiency. The view of the ocean was spectacular! My boyfriend really enjoyed the flatscreen tv. The bathroom was big compared to other hotel bathrooms, which was a plus. The room has a large refrigerator, stove, and utensils, a couch, a nice mirror if you want to do your hair, and a nice balcony. The elevator was quick. At first, the hotel is hard to find, and parking isn't so great. The pool isn't very nice and is VERY small. It's always crowded and there's hardly any room in it - also, if you don't get a chair fast, you can't lay in the sun since other buildings block it for most of the day. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, and even though we spent some time traveling down to the boardwalk, it really isn't that bad. One last thing. The staff here is awesome. My boyfriend and I asked them for advice on where to eat and shop and they answered honestly and nicely which was sooo appreciated. They are friendly and honest and will help you out! Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Judy O
Reviews.Content: From the initial call to make reservations through our check out at the end of our stay everything was perfect. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and contained all the amenities you could ask for. Both my wife and I couldn't ask for more. The Atlantic will now be our place to stay on our vacations to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation...good hotel...would recommend or stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie824
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were originally supposed to rent a condo for a long weekend but our plans fell through. We would have loved to have stayed in Rehoboth but there are only a few oceanfront hotels and they were either booked or way more expensive. While looking for a hotel in OC, I read the reviews of the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn on TripAdvisor. I always read reviews before I book a hotel anywhere. After reading some glowing reviews and some not-so-great reviews, I went ahead and booked an oceanfront king room. Based on the reviews, I made sure to request a room on a high floor (above the 2nd floor) so that we could actually see the ocean from our balcony. We arrived on Thursday around 2:30pm and there was plenty of parking, but our room wasn't ready yet. Check-in time was at 3pm so we drove around a bit before going back. When we went back, the parking lot was almost full but we still found a spot. There were 2 girls at the front desk - the one who checked us in was very friendly and the other one seemed to be too involved in a personal phone call to even give us the time of day. I confirmed our request for a high floor and we were put on the 4th floor which was excellent! We got a parking permit and our keys and went to the room. It was nicer than I expected. My girlfriend (after seeing some news report about bed bugs in hotel rooms) immediately checked the bed to make sure we didn't have any extra visitors....all clear! The view was fantastic! We actually saw some dolphins playing...very cool! I wasn't sure if there would be shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom (which there was, pleasant surprise) so we brought our own just in case. Since we had an oceanfront king, our room was renovated which was a big plus! Great flat screen TV with lots of channels; comfortable, pillow-top mattress; decent bathroom (with shampoo/conditioner/lotion, but no hair dryer so bring your own); large balcony with comfortable chairs (did I mention the excellent view?); well-equiped kitchen (even though we didn't get as much use out of it as we planned); overall it was nice and clean for an old hotel. The housekeeping staff seemed nice although we never actually used their services while we were there. We just reused our towels and didn't really need anything from them so we kept the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door the whole time. Parking was sometimes a problem (no spaces later in the evening) but the maintenence man (I assume) showed us where we could park in the lot. Unfortunately, my car (at some point during the weekend) got scratched, probably by someone not watching where they were going when backing out of a space but it wasn't anything major. Also, there was a room of loud, obnoxious college boys having a big party in their room down the hall one night which woke us up around 3am. All it took was a quick call down to the front desk and within about 5 minutes, the party ended. Kudos to the staff for the quick response. Other than that incident, we slept really well the whole weekend. I brought my laptop even though the reviews had said the WI-FI wasn't great. I'm not sure where everyone else stayed but we had a great WI-FI connection throughout our stay. When I logged on to my computer, it asked for a user name and password to access the WI-FI which we received by calling down to the front desk. Perhaps we were lucky. As for the pool, we only used it once in the late evening. It was very sandy (some people just don't understand about washing off the sand BEFORE going in the pool) but we still went in. We were the ONLY people at the pool at the time which was really nice. It was nice that we were far enough from the boardwalk and the bigger hotels that the beach wasn't as crowded. PROS: Beachfront (not just oceanfront) hotel; great renovated rooms (oceanfront only); large, private balcony; FREE WI-FI; comfortable bed; decent pool; friendly staff; FREE coffee in the lobby; full kitchen; big flat-screen TV with DVD player CONS: No hairdryer in room (which we knew beforehand so brought our own); small parking lot and narrow spaces; water pressure in shower not great (but water was good and hot); knives in kitchen very dull (barely cut a lime for our Coronas); hallways were dark and outdated, could use some sprucing up All in all, we had a wonderful long weekend. We'd definitely go back or at least recommend to anyone looking for a decent oceanfront hotel that's less than $300/night. If they can renovate the rest of the rooms and the public spaces in the hotel, they'll probably get some better reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Sgl52
Reviews.Content: Great location. Steps to the beach and short walks to area attractions. Even though located at 45th street, still able to walk to the boardwalk or take the bus which was located across the street. Room was good size. Included full size refrigerator and stove with all utensils. Bed confortable. Nice furniture, clean, odor free. Great friendly service. Only negative was did not receive good reception with Wii Fi. Didn't use the pool but looked clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommyof311825
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was a little nervous staying here. But my family and I spent a week there and it was a good hotel. If you are looking for a Ritz Carlton then this is not the hotel for you. But it was clean and the room was very spacious. We slept two adults, 3 bigger children and had a pack and play for my little 1 year old. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The night we got there we were unsure of where to park and a very nice gentleman walked outside and guided us to where we should park. I truly appriciated that since it was a late and we drove for a few hours. The last thing I wanted to do was drive around and look for parking. Like I said if you are looking for Ritzy this is not for you. But it was clean, quiet, and friendly. The pool was small but fun especially if you were out there in the evening it was not crowded at all. I would definately stay at this hotel again and recommend it to someone with a family and on a budget. Because lets face it taking 6 people on vacation is not the cheapest thing. Oh and on the corner there is a really good place for

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Bmorechick
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a Thurs-Sat getaway in OC and stayed at this hotel with my parents and niece. Obviously the 'theme' of the getaway was relaxation, beach/pool and sun. For that, the Inn served its purpose. The location was worth the aggravations I encountered. Many hotels/inns/motels in OC state they are oceanfront, but when you drive by them, you notice that there are other buildings DIRECTLY in front of them. Luckily when the Inn stated oceanfront, it truly was! You walk out of the hotel, walk a few steps and you're on the beach. This end of the beach was much quieter because it wasn't directly on the boardwalk. They ran out of parking permits so I was unable to purchase one. Luckily I found a spot on the street, but parking is scarce and if you find one on the street, I suggest you do not move it until it is time for you to check out. The rooms were fairly decent. We had an oceanview room on the 2nd floor. The room wasn't updated but like I said, it was decent. Everything was pretty much in working order. The sofa was disgusting because there were stains all over it and it was just really worn down. I didn't even want to sit on it, let alone pull it out and sleep on it. So I didn't! I liked the fact that it had a kitchen. We didn't cook but used the refrigerator (full size) and the microwave (mini). The pool is small but it was never really crowded so it wasn't an issue. There was quite a bit of sand in the pool. I assume people came from the beach and didn't use the hose that was either right off the beach or the hose that was INSIDE the pool to rinse off. Also, the fliter wasn't running either day I was in it so that was a bit unsanitary I thought. Housekeeping wasn't really an issue. As others stated, the wireless doesn't really work. Luckily I actually took OFF on Friday and didn't try to be sneaky and say I was working from home because there is no way I would have been able to do so in that room! My advice is that if you are traveling with a family or want to actually relax, do not stay during the weekend. On Friday, the college kids took over and I swear it sounded like they were literally bowling in the room above us! I was hoping they were just loud while they were getting ready to go out but this lasted until around 1ish. Then we got some peace and quiet until around 4ish and then it started again. We called to the front desk initially but I doubt they even went up there. And if you stay that close to Seacrets (4 blocks if that) you have to expect that the college kids will be present in abundance. Would I stay at the Inn again? Probably not. I see what it has to offer so I'd probably try someplace else but in no means was it an awful place to stay. It depends on the room you get and what you make of it!

Reviews.Title: “The stay was OK, but don't think we'll stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: chocodoodler
Reviews.Content: when we initially got there the TV was stuck on the the weather channel and the other TV was snowy and only got 5 channels. The afternoon maintence man had no idea how to fix it. So the next morning I went to the desk and mentioned it to the day shift they had the maintence man come up right away. He press and button and it was fixed. My daughter went to get her shoe that got kicked under the bed and there was pretzels and cheese papers under there that weren't ours, don't know how long they've been there and the wheel was off the bed, it was propped up by the phone book. And the only internet service we could get was when we were sitting in the office, apparently it wasn't strong enough to reach our room and that was even on the first floor. But the beds were comfy and the shower was good. the skillet that we had to use had no handle on it, made it kind of rough whent he pan was hot. I had asked for 2nd floor or higher when I made reservation, but when we got there we were on the first floor and just looking at dunes and not the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Nice View of the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Valgirl7
Reviews.Content: First off, note that we were in Ocean City from a Wed to Sat afternoon, which I HIGHLY recommend! It's VERY touristy so a mid week stay is really pleasant! The first room we got at the hotel was ok, note that this hotel claims that all rooms have Queen/Double beds. To me a double bed is a full size bed - and I KNOW those beds in our first room were full size (but I didn't argue the point) but that wasn't why we wanted to get a different room. When we saw the view from our side ocean room (and it was a ground floor room) we decided pretty quickly that we wanted to pay a little extra for an Ocean front view room and lucky for us they had one!! Once we saw the beach we knew we had to have that ocean view room - it's SO PRETTY! They were very nice and the room was ready for us very quickly! The new room was SO much nicer than the first! Plus it had a flat screen tv, a dvd player AND these were definitely queen beds! (My husband and I CAN'T share a full size and if we hadn't had any other options I would not have been happy but they worked with us which was great!) And the view was so beautiful! I think the biggest thing to keep in mind is that it's obvious that this hotel has been there for a long time and has taken a bit of a beating but it was clean, service was great and I really liked the location! Were there stains on the couch? Yes. Was there some damage to the table in the room? Yes. But the room was clean, the kitchenette was perfect and kept down the cost of food, the balcony had two comfortable outdoor lounge chairs, the pool was small but so nice for a quick dip and the view was awesome. As for the location - I loved that it wasn't on the boardwalk (which is tourist central) and the beach wasn't crowded, the parking is tight but we always found a space. We were really pleased over all! I can see where this place may not be so great on the weekends (Sat night especially) considering all the frat boys we saw checking in as we were checking out but we really did enjoy it and look forward to going back again! Oh, two quick things though -first, they have one floor that is smoking (the third) and we were on the second, one afternoon our bathroom smelled strongly of cigarette smoke (the only thing I can think of is that someone above us was smoking in the bathroom above us and I am SUPER sensitive to cigarette smoke) so for a little bit we closed the bathroom door and left the fan on and by the time we got back from the beach it no longer smelled at all. We didn't smell anything like that for the rest of our trip! The second thing - the wireless is not reliable at all but I was on vacation so I didn't really care.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place, great beach access.”
Reviews.Author: brookreeder
Reviews.Content: This place was really bad... it basically had everything wrong with it you could imagine. However, it is RIGHT on the beach (parking too), and that is worth a lot. When we arrived, our non-smoking room was so thick with smoke smell that we couldn't breathe. Other highlights included: - stains on couch - trash on patio - dirty dishes in the kitchen - water ran brown - shower falling out of wall - broken furniture and fixtures - stains, scratches all over the wall, paint in bad condition - office grade carpet - Free wifi didn't work unless you stayed in the kitchen When you consider you can pay the same amount they charged in the summer months as somewhere like the Hyatt Resort in Huntington Beach, it starts to become pretty painful to shell out the money just for that beach access...

Reviews.Title: “We had a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Reesie70
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation. Atlantic Oceanfront Inn was a nice place. The only thing we were very disappointed in was the fact that the ice machine was outside in the heat and never had ice in it. The other thing that was a little disappointing is that the lights over the dining area did not work. Other than that, it was very nice place to stay and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Atlantic was perfect for a little getaway; clean, friendly staff, great views.”
Reviews.Author: frufreak
Reviews.Content: I actually booked a smoking room to save a little money, but somehow ended up with a non-smoking room. I had 2 Q beds and a pull out sofa, flat screen TV, balcony that was oceanfront; really what more could I ask for. Staff was friendly and answered all my questions politely. Free coffee in the lobby. I did not use the Internet service while there so I can't really comment on that. Pool was small, but that didn't really matter to me as I am a beach person. Great location too; in walking distance to Seacrets. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “good deal close to ocean”
Reviews.Author: karengal
Reviews.Content: This is a good motel that is located directly on the beach. The location was awesome. The balconies on the oceanfront rooms provided a bit unease as there were small walls separating the different rooms. There was an odd smell but it was easily ignored. If you want the hotel with all the bells and specialities, do not come here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and met our needs. WILL go again”
Reviews.Author: OJMom
Reviews.Content: We were on the 4th floor, first room toward the ocean with a side ocean view. I was a little concerned with the place/room when we arrived as other reviews said there were holes, mold and dirty things. Our stay was very nice. Everything was clean and what we needed for our stay. Kitchen was clean, stove was clean and all burners worked great. We used them to cook lunches. Fridge nice size. Already has dish soap, hand towel and washcloth. Dishes, cups, pots/pans and lids. Coffee maker, toaster, drink pitcher. Utensils, silverware, etc. Bathroom was clean. No mold, sand, etc. Beds were clean fresh linen and comfy. Couch can convert to a roll out bed. Couch is a light yellow/gold color. Could be updated as they look a tad worn or maybe its just the color. Table and chairs to eating area nice. If your looking for a nice place to stay, steps from the beach entrance, nice price and worth the cost, stay here! We are already planning on coming back each year for our annual beach trip. Pool was nice. 3-5ft. Table and chairs. Ice machine is beside a soda machine out the back exit along the wall. Outdoor shower for spraying off the sand. Considering the hotel is right off the beach, you will drag sand around. The rooms paint is light coloring. The walls on every floor are dark navy blue bottom with a blue top. Carpet is dark blue wiht some swirly type design. The dark colors make the halls look very dark and dreary. They could be painted more bright colors to go with the bright yellow exterior. Floor 1-2 oceanfront are not a good view. Floor 3-5 are best views. Oceanfront room on floor 4 or 5 is recommended. Overall 1-10 I'd give our experience an 8 and recommend to others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a beach hotel.”
Reviews.Author: familyfun31
Reviews.Content: Only stay in suite, that is 2 bedroom. Corner unit gives you a window in bedroom. Stay above 2nd floor for a better view of water. Oceanfront is nice, water is very close to hotel. No dishwasher but full size fridge, stove, oven and microwave. Ac in living area and bedroom. Nice tv with alot of channels. Pool is small only goes to 5 ft, but was very clean and opened late, we left at 11:15, still open.

Reviews.Title: “large efficiency”
Reviews.Author: jackatthebeach
Reviews.Content: liked the hotel especially size of room. right on the beach, great view, good location, excellent staff. the hotel was clean and seemed new or at least refurbished. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “MY BEST VISIT TO OC SO FAR”
Reviews.Author: melisamous
Reviews.Content: went to oc with my husbands two aunts which happen to be my best friends. it was the best vacation to oc i've had to date. the room was nice and spacious. the maid service was spectacular. her name was louella and she was the best. she was very friendly and helpful. the hospitality of the rest of the staff was great. we stayed in a room on the second floor with an oceanview. it was absolutely beautiful. this hotel is right on the beach. no buildings blocking view. and a nice little outside shower to get the sand off of you before you go up to your room. the only thing i can think to tell you is if you get an oceanview room, not oceanfront, take a little dvd player to hook up. otherwise you just have basic cable. i will deffinately be back!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: mssy869
Reviews.Content: Nasty, just nasty. This hotel was such a waste of my money. The room was like those aired on TV where hidden cameras reveal all of the uncleanliness. Though plenty of the filth was evident there were lots of hidden problems too. Immediately upon entering the room, I noticed a huge dead fly that had been mashed on the wall. In looking out of the balcony to view the ocean I noticed an empty beer can just sitting there. To make things worse, when I went to use the microwave there was a half eaten piece of pizza left inside with splatters of tomatoes sauce everywhere. As we prepared to go to bed, we noticed sand all over the bedspread. Though management seemed disappointed with their obviously poor housekeeping, they only offered me a 50% return of one nights stay. This is ludicrous. To continue on the terrible journey on Sunday morning we requested housekeeping service. When we returned to the room the tub still had sand in it from the night before, shoes that were left about the room had not been moved but the housekeeper left us one of those envelopes with her name on it, hoping for tip. I’d like to know how you clean a tub and leave in dirt or how you vacuum the carpet without moving anything from the center of the floor. The table where we had eaten had not been wiped. The only thing that I could discern that may and I say “may” with the utmost optimism, is that she may have changed the wash cloth and towels (though on the first night the ones in the bathroom looked like that were left from the previous occupants. I wouldn’t go back to this hotel if the rooms where FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: bugbunny1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the dirtiest I have ever stayed in. The oven was filthy and full of grease, room had a very heavy smell of smoke, showerhead full of mold, stove knobs filthy and very poor housekeeping. No hair dryer, no shampoo and broken outlets. I brought these matters to the attention of staff and they totally ignored me. I felt like I was bothering them. Bed sheets smelled like smoke and toilet was dirty. Pop-up assembly broken and just an overall miserable stay. Even cheerios all over the floor. Bad bed bugs and insect infestation. Even the outdoor pool is crap. Stay away at all costs. Almost impossible to find a parking space. Ice machine outside and full of sand.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun, will absolutely return!”
Reviews.Author: LV2010
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, safe and comfortable. Great view! Also slept very well... I went with my sister for her 18th birthday and we just had a blast! We will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we gave this one a second chance...”
Reviews.Author: beachluvncupl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel about 3 1/2 years ago for a brief visit to OC. We were very dissatisfied with the condition of the hotel; it was somewhat run down and not extremely clean. Fortunately, we only had to stay for one night. While searching for accomodations for the most recent visit (as we visit OC 2-3 times a year), we decided to check the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn's website (not expecting to actually stay there again). To our suprise, it mentioned that ALL of the oceanfront rooms and most of the oceanview rooms had been remodeled. Photos of the renovations were included, and it looked very nice! The price was very reasonable (around $50/ night), and the view & location, we already knew was wonderful! We agreed to give the A.O.I. one more chance, and are so glad that we did!!! The room was indeed like new, all new furniture, linens & accesories. I was told that they are in a lease for the time being and that more improvements are on the way. I would suggest that the hallways are refaced, balcony doors replaced and bathrooms could use a touch up. But please don't be deceived by the community spaces if they haven't been updated yet because the true beauty is definately inside the guest rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: LaylaAnn65
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the improved reviews over the last 3 months we decided to go for this property and we are grateful that we did. Upon arrival, the exterior presents with a circa 1950's motor lodge appearance. But we were overwhelmed with the updated interior of our oceanfront suite. The housekeeping and maintenance staff was friendly and helpful. The interior corridors did smell of cigarette smoke but our suite was fine. The ice machine was in a precarious spot located outside of the building by the parking lot. The entrances to the property were not key-coded entry. Parking lot was ample, could use a bike rack. This property was centrally located and budget friendly. We will definitely consider this property for future trips to OC.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for what is was, but it was'nt all that!”
Reviews.Author: sailorgirl45
Reviews.Content: We did not go with the highest of expectations, we wanted budget and that is exactly what we got. We had a two room suite on the 2nd floor facing north. Had requested that we be on the 5th floor facing south, this was totally ignored. At check in front desk clerk seems bothered by any requests or suggestions. When we entered the parking lot by the pool we noticed that is was halfway drained and the filters had not been running because it was dirty. Figured they were getting ready to close it up for the winter. There was another couple checking in before us and they asked what amenities the hotel offered and the clerk had the nerve to point to and suggest the pool. Weird. The room itself had been remolded with new carpet, new dressers, countertops, and appliances. No dishwasher in the little kitchen, and housekeepping does not do dishes, which led us to wonder how they were santized between guests. Washed all dishes in scalding hot water before we used them. The beds were also new and comfy with white crisp linens. Towels we big and fluffy and bathroon was clean upon arrival. After that housekeeping never cleaned the tub ( mat never taken off bottom and we could see our own hairs) we had 3 tissues in a box under the sink, after using these and throwing the box away we never received another box of tissues the entire stay(4 days). Seperate air conditioning units in the bedroom and the living area, but I ran both of them at full blast for hours and could not get the rooms to cool any lower than 78 degrees. The AC unit in the living area was situated so that if you sat on the balcony with it running you could not hear the ocean or anything else. The unit in the bedroom was so loud that it atcually startled you awake when the fan would kick on. The little bedroom was tiny and had only a bed and dresser, no TV, no clock or radio. The living area had a sofa, table and four chairs, another bed, nightstand, dresser, flat scrren TV and DVD player,clock radio and an old fashioned Ma Bell princess phone when picked up was nothing but static. There were no instuctions or guides in the room. No restaurant or attraction guides, nothing explaining the layout of the hotel or where anything was located. Had to figure all this out for yourself. Not even anything printed on the phone about how to dail the front desk, or get an outside line. No TV channel list and nothing about what to do in the event of a fire. They advertise free WIFI throughout the hotel, they only way I could find to connect was sit on the floor by the entrance to our room. If I moved even over to the bed 4 feet away it would disconnect. Ice machine was outside with one soda machine which wanted $1.75 for a 20oz soda. There were two luggage carts for the entire hotel and the only entrance was up a ramp at a 45 degree angle. Difficult to say the least for loading and unloading luggage. The best thing of all was the two holes in the living area wall in the newly renovated room. Well, they have tried to spruce up the rooms but they have a long way to go before I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “the room was clean and the view was great”
Reviews.Author: clay31
Reviews.Content: it was not the best , but it was clean and the service was good . it could use some up date , like paint and couch , but other wise i cant say anything else. I would like to know if we come back next year could we have the same room? my wife loved it. that is the roon we would like. look forward to hearing from you clayton r cole

Reviews.Title: “nice room, and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: mamao5
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms which included a full kitchen and private balcony that was right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “It was breath taking”
Reviews.Author: sherclaire1
Reviews.Content: It was the best vacation I have been on ever. The place was exactly what it proclaimed on the internet to be. We had a wonderful time. The staff were friendly, courtious and accomodating. The inn was very convenient. We could walk to all of the places we wanted to see. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need to enjoy the beach”
Reviews.Author: wineman2004
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn for 3-4 years in a row now. I keep coming back because most of the rooms have a spectacular ocean front view and are priced very reasonably! The staff are helpful and easy to deal with and parking is plentiful. A recent renovation bought more comfortable beds/linens and flat screen tv's. Rooms are spacious with kichenettes, fresh/clean bathrooms and all the comforts of home. The location is within a few blocks of the Ocean City Conference Center and close to virtually everything. The comfortable chairs on the balconies allow for a peaceful enjoyment of listening to the waves break on the shore!

Reviews.Title: “better then anytime we stayed”
Reviews.Author: redhead66MtJoy_pa_
Reviews.Content: Vvery clean rooms ,when asked for extra towels and bedding they brought it up in very good time.We have been staying there for years and glad it is under new management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 100HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Atlantic Oceanfront. From the time we arrived, we were impressed with our stay. Those at the front desk were polite and aimed to please. We called for 2 minor problems and maintenance arrived within 2 minutes. Housekeeping was great also. This place is quiet and a refreshing change from some of the other hotels. The best thing was a great value for the money. Hotel rooms include flat screen TV and large dining table with 4 chairs. I I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beachgrrl22
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel based on some of the previous reviews but I was hopeful because many of the newer reviews said there had been remodeling as well as new management and things were very nice. I must say that I have to agree. The location is excellent. It's about 20 streets up from the boardwalk and it is literally right on the beach. We stayed in an oceanfront efficiency suite and our balcony overlooked the ocean. The rooms were wonderful. Ours had two separate rooms. The first had a queen bed, nightstand and a dresser and the second had a queen bed and a pullout sleeper sofa as well as a flatscreen tv, coffee table, dresser, nightstand and dining table for four. There is a kitchen equipped with fridge, oven and range, microwave, coffee maker and there are even some dishes and cookware. The staff was very friendly and everything was clean. The pool was clean, too. For the price this place was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value! Excellent Location! We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lovesitcozy
Reviews.Content: My partner and 1 yr old daughter just returned from 4 days in OC at the Atlantic Ocean Front hotel and can't wait to go back! The hotel was nice. Very reasonably priced compared to other ocean front hotels and the rooms were spacious, clean and quite nice. Even the non oceanfront rooms still had a pretty view. Having a full kitchen was awesome, especially with a baby in tow. It was wonderful being a stones throw from the beach and 45th st is an excellent central location for going to the Boardwalk, Assateague Island, Rehoboth Beach and even Salisbury. The staff at the hotel was very accomodating and even allowed us to change rooms for a king size bed. They were even kind enough to move our stuff so we didn't have to keep running back to the hotel for the change. Overall, it was an awesome trip and we would DEFINITELY recccomend this hotel to our friends and family. Another note is if you want great takeout steamed crabs, we highly reccomend Higgins on 32nd st and don't forget the Thrashers Fries and Fishers popcorn!

Reviews.Title: “nice price for location.”
Reviews.Author: pleighdoe
